s0821: Third year, Pang Juan led, attacked Yan, captured their general Ju Xin.
s0822: Fourth year, Pang Juan led Zhao, Chu, Wei, Yan's elite troops, attacked Qin Zhui, did not capture it;
s0823: shifted to attack Qi, took Rao An.
s0824: Fifth year, Fu Di led, resided at Ping Yi;
s0825: Qing She led Dongyang Hedong troops, guarded He Liang.
s0826: Sixth year, enfeoffed Chang'an Jun with Rao.
s0828: Ninth year, Zhao attacked Yan, took Li and Yang Cheng.
s0829: Troops not yet withdrawn, Qin attacked Ye, captured it.
s0830: Dao Xiang Wang died, son You Mu Wang Qian ascended.
s0831: You Mu Wang Qian first year, walled Bo Ren.
s0832: Second year, Qin attacked Wu Cheng, Hu Zhe led troops to rescue it, army defeated, died there.
s0833: Third year, Qin attacked Chi Li and Yi An, Li Mu led troops and fought them at Fei, repelled them.
s0834: Enfeoffed Mu as Wu An Jun.
s0835: Fourth year, Qin attacked Fan Wu, Li Mu fought them, repelled them.
s0836: Fifth year, Dai territory greatly shook, from Le Xu westward, north to Ping Yin, towers houses walls mostly destroyed, ground cracked east-west 130 paces.
s0837: Sixth year, great famine, people falsely said: 'Zhao will wail, Qin will laugh.
s0838: If you do not believe, look at the ground growing hair.'
s0840: Seventh year, Qin attacked Zhao, Zhao great general Li Mu, general Sima Shang led, struck them.
s0841: Li Mu executed, Sima Shang dismissed, Zhao Cong and Qi general Yan Ju replaced them.
s0842: Zhao Cong's army broken, Yan Ju fled away.
s0844: Eighth year tenth month, Handan became Qin.
s0846: I heard Feng Wang Sun say: 'Zhao king Qian, his mother was a singing girl, favored by Dao Xiang Wang.
s0847: Dao Xiang Wang deposed rightful son Jia and established Qian.
s0848: Qian originally had no conduct, believed slander, therefore executed his good general Li Mu, used Guo Kai.'
s0850: Qin having captured Qian, Zhao's fugitive officials together established Jia as king, reigned in Dai for six years, Qin advanced troops broke Jia, then extinguished Zhao to make it a commandery.
